alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 19 at 4:22AM EDT until March 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Lake Effect Snow. Total snow accumulations 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 mph will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Northern Herkimer County and northwestern Hamilton County. Highest snowfall amounts expected north of Route 28. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Snow may lead to slippery travel conditions, especially on untreated surfaces. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The lake effect snow band early this morning will be oriented north of Route 28 with snowfall rates 1 to 2 inches per hour. The band will then drop southward, reaching the Mohawk Valley by mid to late morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
